thread.title: Which States, Cities and Counties Have the Best Websites?
thread.title_full: Which States, Cities and Counties Have the Best Websites?

author: admin
title: Which States, Cities and Counties Have the Best Websites?
text:
City of Los Angeles, Calif.City of Raleigh, N.C. City of Riverside, Calif. Town of West Hartford, Conn. 
Presented along with the Best of the Web Awards, the Digital Government Achievement Awards (DGAA) highlight outstanding agency and department websites and apps. These awards by the Center for Digital Government are presented in eight categories. 2015 DGAA winners include New Zealand's website for small businesses, U.S. Department of Transportation's pre-employment screening program for motor carriers, and more than 30 state and local government applications and websites. 
View the complete list of BOW and DGAA awardees here . 
About the Center for Digital Government | www.centerdigitalgov.com 
The Center for Digital Government is a national research and advisory institute focused on technology policy and best practices in state and local government. 
The Center is a division of e.Republic, the nation's only media and research company focused exclusively on state and local government and education . www.erepublic.com Contact:
